segments.text: I can't believe how calm everything looks outside the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden is so tidy and peaceful, it's a stark contrast to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the path winding through the low bushes, it looks so inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could step through the window and take a walk outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen, on the other hand, is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water is overflowing from the sink, and the kids are making a ruckus.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman is still drying dishes, oblivious to it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she should take a break and enjoy the view outside instead.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a nice day, it's a shame to spend it cooped up inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I would love to feel the sun on my face and the breeze in my hair.
segments.speaker: PAR
